channel.title: GAC on Sina's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in GAC on Sina's Blog

item.title: How to Explore Special Folders (like GAC) in Windows Explorer
item.description: In normal situations you cannot view the content of special folders, such as Windows/assembly or Windows/fonts, and so on. The way these folders are shown are set through the desktop.ini file in each of these folders, which is normally hidden and protected. One trick that I learned from here [+] is described below. Open a command prompt and type: cd /d %windows%\assembly attrib -r -h -s desktop.ini ren desktop.ini desktop.bak Using the above commands, we kill the desktop.
